item.title: Modern Family S01E06 영어 표현
item.description: 1. have/know sth down patto know something so well that you can say or do it without having to try or think. - Jay: I wasn’t the greatest husband the first time around, but, I’m tyring to do better this time. And maybe by my third marriage, I’ll have it down pat. 2. mean to~ 할 셈이다. - Phil: What ya reading there? A book? - Claire: Yeah. I’ve been meaning to get to it for a while.

item.title: Modern Family S01E02 영어 표현
item.description: 1. put one’s foot down단호한 태도를 취하다. - Phil: Sometimes a man’s gotta put his foot down and do what a man’s gotta do. 2. rub sb the wrong wayto annoy someone without intending to. - Mitchell: Her future best friend might be in that class, and I don’t wanna rub anyone the wrong way. 3. start sb off1. ~에게(~을 하기) 시작하게 하다. 2. ~가 (~을) 시작하도록 하다[돕다/이끌다]. - Danielle: Okay, we’re gonna start with the Hello Dance, and then we’re gonna move on to blocks, then finger painting, and then we’re gonna do our Family Dance.

item.title: Modern Family S01E01 영어 표현
item.description: 1. totalTo damage something extremely badly. To destroy something completely. - Phil: That is totaled. 2. banister난간. - Alex: Luke got his head stuck in the banister again. 3. notch단, 단계, 급. - Gloria: No, no. He tripped him, Jay. Where’s the penalty? - Jay: Gloria, they’re 0 and 6. Let’s take it down a notch. 4. tell someone offTo tell someone that they have done something wrong and that you are angry about it.

item.title: Modern Family S01E16 영어 표현
item.description: 1. get off to…으로 시작하다. - Cameron: We got off to an awkward start with our pediatrician, a very nice Asian lady named Dr. Miura. 2. queena gay man. - Cameron: Why do you think the dentist gives me all that free stuff? - Mitchell: Um, because he’s a huge queen and he has a big crush on you. 3. by all means? - Manny: I have a fever.

item.title: Modern Family S01E15 영어 표현
item.description: 1. trump(더 나응 말 또는 행동으로 상대를) 이기다[능가하다]. - Phil: Did he trump me? You tell me. He made a painting out of a photograph one time. I have hand-picked a card, drawn a heart in the steam on the medicine cabinet, and taken Claire to Fratelli’s, a family-style Italian restaurant, for 17 years in a row. Yeah, he got me. He got me. 2. settle1. 합의를 보다. 2. ?

item.title: Modern Family S01E14 영어 표현
item.description: 1. not have a clueto have no knowledge about something, or to be unable to remember something. - Haley: I need to date someone who has a clue, instead of an idioit who bangs his head every time he rides his bike out of his garage- every time! 2. clutchcool. - Phil: That movie’s so clutch. 3. splash대성공. - Claire: I don’t mind saying I was making quite a splash.

item.title: Modern Family S01E13 영어 표현
item.description: 1. come out of the closetAdmitting to being gay. - Mitchell: I came out of the closet in my mid-20s. 2. as they comeVery. - Jay: These guys don’t understand the gay thing. Why create an awkward situation? That’s all I’m saying. - Mitchell: That’s weird, because your friend Shorty there- gay as they come. 3. put outTo be willing to engage in casual sexual activity; be sexually available.

item.title: Modern Family S01E12 영어 표현
item.description: 1. old ball and chainone’s wife. - Jay: So, trouble in gay paradise, huh? - Mitchell: He just can’t say no to anybody who needs help. And why do you have to always add the word “gay” where it doesn’t belong? - Jay: Hey, hey, you’re not mad at me. You’re mad at the old balls and chain.

item.title: Modern Family S01E11 영어 표현
item.description: 1. out of the blue갑자기, 난데없이. - Jay: The hell is he doing here? - Gloria: Jay. - Jay: No. He was supposed to pick up Manny yesterday and disappointed him again, as usual. Now he just sails in here out of the blue? 2. by all means물론, 분명히. - Phil: By all means, Claire, we want you looking your sexiest when the hunky, gay firemen get here! 3. pool포켓볼(여러 색깔의 공 16개로 하는 당구 비슷한 게임.
